title: How Does Google Analytics Work?
description: Well, if you are not into online business or SEO, there are high chances you have never heard of this tool. Dont worry; you have come to the right place. We are going to describe what this tool is and what it does in brief detail. So, read thoroughly! Introduction to...
detailDescription:
Well, if you are not into online business or SEO, there are high chances you have never heard of this tool. Don’t worry; you have come to the right place. We are going to describe what this tool is and what it does in brief detail. So, read thoroughly!

Introduction to Google Analytics

Put Simple, Google Analytics is a free-of-cost tracking tool offered by the Internet Giant, Google. This tool helps you understand how people use your website. Let’s take this example, you run an eCommerce store, and you want to know how many visitors your site gets each day or where they come from, including location and device; you need to use Google Analytics Tool

What Does it Do?

Google Analytics provides you with useful insights about your website. These insights cover user behavior on your website and some other information. Following, we will explain a few reasons why you should use this tool for your online business:
  • It helps to measure your website’s performance
  • It evaluates your marketing efforts and sees whether they bring in results or not
  • Sees and advice on how to change for the better
  • Google Analytics also divides the site data into different categories according to criteria like age, gender, country, and device)

How does It work?

This free tool, Google Analytics, collects data using different approaches, including cookies, JavaScript code, and browser code. The program collects important information from the website with the code generated once a visitor accesses your website through any browser.

Data Collection

As for Mobile users, Google Analytics features an additional code that lets you track mobile users. It utilizes JavaScript code to obtain data from websites.
It records every visit or time when they view the page with this code.
Let us explain the data collection process:
  1. It helps to measure your website’s performance
  2. It evaluates your marketing efforts and sees whether they bring in resolts or not
  3. Sees and advice on how to change for the better
  4. Google Analytics also divides the site data into different categories according to criteria like age, gender, country, and device)
